title: Sigma-54/Nitrogen Regulation Feature
description: This feature specifically detects sigma-54-dependent transcriptional regulators and nitrogen regulatory operons (glnK/amtB) in bacterial genomes. It activates strongly directly at or immediately adjacent to these regulatory elements, which control nitrogen metabolism and related functions. The feature recognizes both the transcriptional components (sigma-54 regulators) and the downstream regulated elements in the nitrogen fixation pathway. This pattern is highly consistent across diverse bacterial phyla including proteobacteria and firmicutes, suggesting it captures a fundamental regulatory mechanism for nitrogen metabolism that has been evolutionarily conserved. The activation corresponds to DNA sequences likely containing binding motifs for these specialized transcription factors.
